thread.title: These 5 Bridal Beauty Looks, By Celebrity Make-Up Artist Namrata Soni, Are Just Perfect
thread.title_full: These 5 Bridal Beauty Looks, By Celebrity Make-Up Artist Namrata Soni, Are Just Perfect

title: These 5 Bridal Beauty Looks, By Celebrity Make-Up Artist Namrata Soni, Are Just Perfect
text:
facebook 
We love how make-up artist Namrata Soni creates enchanting beauty looks for Sonam Kapoor. From her experimental eye make-up to her captivating hairdos, we want to emulate every look she creates. But, have you seen her bridal looks? Her brides look enchanting. These are the looks we think you can try for your big day. Princess hair 
She is known for her complex hairdos. Just look the charm of these effortless waves, perfect for a day celebration. We love the effortless waves interwoven with these quaint little flowers. We want to try it now. A photo posted by namratasoni (@namratasoni) on Nov 25, 2016 at 6:56am PST Lashes done right 
Here, the make-up artist is showing us the importance of false lashes and the way they can open up one's peepers. They go exceptionally well with smokey eyes. So, it's best you start practising now. A video posted by namratasoni (@namratasoni) on Dec 13, 2016 at 5:40am PST Soft make-up 
Sometimes, less is more. It's not necessary that you have to cake on products to look your best. Take a look at this bride with a winged liner (with false lashes, of course) and a pinkish nude matte pout. A photo posted by namratasoni (@namratasoni) on Dec 8, 2016 at 7:28am PST Unconventional smokey eyes 
Your smokey eyes don't necessarily have to be a mix of gold and black. You can always experiment with different colours. But make sure not to go overboard. Bluish-grey smokey eyes look extremely enchanting, and you can pair them with a bright coral lipstick. A photo posted by namratasoni (@namratasoni) on Jan 14, 2017 at 8:44pm PST Fairytale look 
Long curls cascading over the shoulders, paired with a classic black smokey eye and glistening nude lipstick, is a must for your cocktail party. Namrata wants you to blend-in your eye make-up, so that you don't leave any stark edges. A video posted by namratasoni (@namratasoni) on Jan 13, 2017 at 10:20am PST
